name: 2,2'-[(2-Nitrophenyl)methylene]bis(5-methylfuran)
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2832
Reason: 2,2'-[(2-Nitrophenyl)methylene]bis(5-methylfuran) has a melting point that we will compare to the melting point of furan, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The basic unit for our comparison will be furan, which has a melting point of -10.0°C. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of two additional phenyl rings and a nitro group. Phenyl groups, when connected to a furan ring, tend to increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. Additionally, the methyl group introduces a rigid structure, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might lower the melting point by approximately -10°C.
